title: Part A
stimulusHtml:
Select a point value to view scoring criteria and/or examples, and to score the response.

One point for stating that the rate of natural increase is high.

Two points for describing the rate of natural increase as high due to the expanding numbers of children born into each youth cohort.
descriptions: The response does not correctly describe the rate of natural increase indicated by the shape of the population pyramid shown using one of the following:
The response correctly describes the rate of natural increase indicated by the shape of the population pyramid shown using one of the following :
The response correctly describes the rate of natural increase indicated by the shape of the population pyramid shown using one of the following :

title: Part B
stimulusHtml:
Select a point value to view scoring criteria and/or examples, and to score the response.

One point for stating that a culture group may value multiple children.

Two points for explaining how a culture group may promote large families by placing value on children, placing women in maternal roles, restrict contraception, or using pronatalist policies.
descriptions: The response does not correctly explain one of the following cultural factors that may contribute to the local population trend shown in the graph:
The response correctly explains one of the following cultural factors that may contribute to the local population trend shown in the graph:
The response correctly explains one of the following cultural factors that may contribute to the local population trend shown in the graph:

title: Part C
stimulusHtml:
Select a point value to view scoring criteria and/or examples, and to score the response.

One point for stating that poverty or prices may be push factors.

Two points for explaining people may move away due to local poverty, increasing costs, or decreasing prices for what they produce.
descriptions: The response does not correctly explain one of the following degrees to which economic push factors may affect the population structure for the community shown in the graph:
The response correctly explains one of the following degrees to which economic push factors may affect the population structure for the community shown in the graph:
The response correctly explains one of the following degrees to which economic push factors may affect the population structure for the community shown in the graph:

title: Part D
stimulusHtml:
Select a point value to view scoring criteria and/or examples, and to score the response.

One point for stating that more jobs will be needed for young workers.

Two points for explaining that the increasing size of the youth-dependent age cohorts indicates that there will be a corresponding increase in the available labor pool over the years who will require paid work.
descriptions: The response does not correctly explain one of the following possible outcomes regarding future employment needs based on the population pyramid shown:
The response correctly explains one of the following possible outcomes regarding future employment needs based on the population pyramid shown:
The response correctly explains one of the following possible outcomes regarding future employment needs based on the population pyramid shown:
